7/ I posit we'll see a lot more experimentation in seeding a #cryptoasset to "human utility providers." Thus far, such models have largely focused on "machine utility providers."
6/ 100% of an asset base sitting in financiers' hands, while providing little utility value to a #cryptonetwork , could be the death of that network long run.
5/ It's necessary to seed a #cryptoasset into utility providers' hands, or else the network will have a hard time scaling the service it provides.
4/ #ICOs prioritize the distribution of the #cryptoasset to the financier masses. Earlier distribution models (e.g., mining) always issued to utility providers.
3/ The SEC alone could change the preferred issuance model of #cryptoassets , which wouldn't necessarily be a bad thing for the space.
2/ Note that Jay Clayton later distinguishes between #ICOs and #bitcoin + #ether , the former having hallmark security characteristics, while $ BTC + $ ETH do not. pic.twitter.com/y32a8SLOCH
